Our diverse range of glass containers offers superior packaging solutions to clients across various sectors, including soft drinks, beer, spirits, cosmetics, and pharmaceuticals. We are committed to delivering excellence in our products. At Beta Glass, we are not just suppliers; we are partners in progress, dedicated to setting new standards in the glass packaging industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Internal Audit Supervisor

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	To support the Internal Audit Manager in delivering effective risk-based audit services across the business.
	The role ensures sound internal control, policy compliance, and risk management by executing audits, reporting key findings, and supporting the follow-up of agreed corrective actions.


Responsibilities


	Participate in developing the annual risk-based audit plan.
	Execute assigned audits end-to-end in line with audit standards and timelines.
	Evaluate and test internal controls and risk mitigation practices.
	Prepare audit workpapers and issue memoranda with clear recommendations.
	Prepare and submit timely and quality audit reports rated satisfactory by the Internal Audit Manager.
	Track resolution of audit recommendations and update audit issue logs.
	Support investigations into fraud, misconduct, or whistleblower cases.
	Recommend process improvements and support policy awareness campaigns.
	Participate in cross-functional audit team exercises and knowledge sharing.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Accounting or any other related disciplines
	4-6 years of experience
	Accounting qualification e.g. ACA, ACCA and familiarity on IAS/IFRS Standard
	CIA or CISA is an added advantage
	Risk-based auditing
	Report writing and documentation
	Internal control assessment
	Basic IT audit knowledge (infrastructure, access controls, backups, etc.)
	Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.

Internal Audit Supervisor Job at Beta Glass




        
    

        
        Beta Glass, a proud member of the Frigoglass Group, stands as a strategic partner to international beverage bottlers. Positioned as a major supplier of glass packaging, we play a crucial role in the burgeoning markets of West and Central Africa.

Our diverse range of glass containers offers superior packaging solutions to clients across various sectors, including soft drinks, beer, spirits, cosmetics, and pharmaceuticals. We are committed to delivering excellence in our products. At Beta Glass, we are not just suppliers; we are partners in progress, dedicated to setting new standards in the glass packaging industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Audit Supervisor
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	To support the Internal Audit Manager in delivering effective risk-based audit services across the business.
	The role ensures sound internal control, policy compliance, and risk management by executing audits, reporting key findings, and supporting the follow-up of agreed corrective actions.


Responsibilities


	Participate in developing the annual risk-based audit plan.
	Execute assigned audits end-to-end in line with audit standards and timelines.
	Evaluate and test internal controls and risk mitigation practices.
	Prepare audit workpapers and issue memoranda with clear recommendations.
	Prepare and submit timely and quality audit reports rated satisfactory by the Internal Audit Manager.
	Track resolution of audit recommendations and update audit issue logs.
	Support investigations into fraud, misconduct, or whistleblower cases.
	Recommend process improvements and support policy awareness campaigns.
	Participate in cross-functional audit team exercises and knowledge sharing.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor's Degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Accounting or any other related disciplines
	4-6 years of experience
	Accounting qualification e.g. ACA, ACCA and familiarity on IAS/IFRS Standard
	CIA or CISA is an added advantage
	Risk-based auditing
	Report writing and documentation
	Internal control assessment
	Basic IT audit knowledge (infrastructure, access controls, backups, etc.)
	Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.

Online Sales Specialist Job at Cworth Energy




        
    

        
        Cworth Energy is a high-tech new energy enterprise integrating research and development, production, project design, installation guidance, and after-sales service. We have overseas offices in Nigeria and Cameroon, and our products cover over 50 countries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Online Sales Specialist
Job Location: Festac, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a passionate and results-driven Online Sales Specialist to manage online enquiries, convert leads into customers, and ensure excellent service delivery across all digital platforms.
	You’ll be the first point of contact for online prospects — driving engagement, closing deals, and supporting customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and respond promptly to customer enquiries across social media, website, WhatsApp, and email.
	Develop and implement online sales strategies to meet weekly, monthly, and quarterly targets.
	Follow up with potential clients, convert leads to paying customers, and maintain accurate CRM records.
	Provide professional online customer support — resolving issues and ensuring satisfaction.
	Optimize online sales funnels, monitor conversion rates, and suggest improvements.
	Attend to walk-in customers at the office, providing product information and completing sales transactions.


Requirements


	1 - 3 years of experience in online or digital sales.
	Proven ability to meet or exceed sales targets.
	Strong communication, persuasion, and customer service skills.
	Good understanding of CRM tools, online sales funnels, and digital communication platforms.
	Media or Digital Marketing certification is an added advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@cworthenergy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Manager, Compliance",
  "description": "9mobile is a Nigerian private limited liability company. EMTS acquired a Unified Access Service License from the Nigerian Communications Commission in 2007. The License enables EMTS provide Fixed Telephony (wired or wireless), Digital Mobile Services, International Gateway Services and National/Regional Long Distance Services in addition to spectrum assignments in the 900 and 1800 MHz bands.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Manager, Compliance

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	To ensure EMTS complies with all applicable laws, regulations, internal policies, and industry standards.
	The role involves developing compliance frameworks, monitoring adherence, and providing guidance to mitigate compliance risks across the business.


Roles and&nbsp;Responsibilities
Tactical:


	Compliance Framework &amp; policy Management.
	Assist in articulating EMTS&rsquo;s compliance policy and in driving organisation-wide adherence.
	Develop and maintain compliance policies, procedures, and guidelines.
	Champion alignment with regulatory requirements and industry best practices


Operational:


	Conduct compliance risk assessments across business units.
	Develop and update EMTS&rsquo; compliance matrix to ensure that compliance roles, responsibilities and timelines are adequately communicated to the business.
	Recommend and implement corrective actions to mitigate compliance risks.
	Escalate all potential and known compliance violations to the Head, Corporate Risk &amp; Compliance.
	Liaise with relevant units/functions in ensuring adherence to EMTS&rsquo;s compliance framework.
	Design and deliver compliance training programs for employees.
	Promote a culture of compliance throughout the organization.
	Coordinate compliance audit exercises across the business.
	Ensure an excellent relationship is built with mid and senior level managers across all divisions &amp; departments in EMTS.

Manager, Compliance Job at 9mobile




        
    

        
        9mobile is a Nigerian private limited liability company. EMTS acquired a Unified Access Service License from the Nigerian Communications Commission in 2007. The License enables EMTS provide Fixed Telephony (wired or wireless), Digital Mobile Services, International Gateway Services and National/Regional Long Distance Services in addition to spectrum assignments in the 900 and 1800 MHz bands.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, Compliance

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To ensure EMTS complies with all applicable laws, regulations, internal policies, and industry standards.
	The role involves developing compliance frameworks, monitoring adherence, and providing guidance to mitigate compliance risks across the business.


Roles and Responsibilities
Tactical:


	Compliance Framework & policy Management.
	Assist in articulating EMTS’s compliance policy and in driving organisation-wide adherence.
	Develop and maintain compliance policies, procedures, and guidelines.
	Champion alignment with regulatory requirements and industry best practices


Operational:


	Conduct compliance risk assessments across business units.
	Develop and update EMTS’ compliance matrix to ensure that compliance roles, responsibilities and timelines are adequately communicated to the business.
	Recommend and implement corrective actions to mitigate compliance risks.
	Escalate all potential and known compliance violations to the Head, Corporate Risk & Compliance.
	Liaise with relevant units/functions in ensuring adherence to EMTS’s compliance framework.
	Design and deliver compliance training programs for employees.
	Promote a culture of compliance throughout the organization.
	Coordinate compliance audit exercises across the business.
	Ensure an excellent relationship is built with mid and senior level managers across all divisions & departments in EMTS.
	Ensure adequate training and development is delivered to team members on compliance related issues.
	Investigate compliance breaches and recommend remedial actions.
	Prepare/compile and submit agreed periodic activity and compliance performance reports for the attention of the Head, Corporate Risk & Compliance.
	Perform any other duties as assigned by the Head, Corporate Risk & Compliance


Requirements


	First Degree or equivalent in a relevant discipline.

	Knowledge of Telecom sector and current trends in the Industry
	Good knowledge of regulatory frameworks and compliance standards
	High ethical standards and attention to detail
	Good Presentation & Interpersonal skills
	Strong communication and stakeholder management abilities

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content & Email Marketing Specialist (Undergraduate / NYSC)

Job Location: Nigeria

Summary

	Develop and execute email marketing campaigns (newsletters, follow-ups, nurturing sequences).

	Strong writing and communication skills.

	Interest in digital marketing, storytelling, and analytics.
	Creative mindset with data-driven thinking.
	Must be a student, pre-NYSC, NYSC, or ≤2 years post-NYSC.

	Experience with Canva, & Google Workspace Sheets.

	Hands-on experience with cutting-edge tools and real-world projects.
	Flexible work schedule.
	Remote-friendly.
